comments:
Using TPTP-4.2.0-200601050100 I tried to launch a manual and an automated GUI test suite under two different Windows XP machines.

The execution progress consistently gets stuck at 57% with my CPU maxed out.  I have to always kill the workbench in order to cancel the launch.

I guess the problem I've just encountered is the same one.
I give you the stack I have on the RAC side it would be useful for you.

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/core/runtime/IProgressMonitor
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:1784)
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethod(Class.java:1382)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt
endedImpl.executeCommand(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:126)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt
endedImpl.run(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:272)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:568)

This problem is covered in bugzilla 123822.  Here is the workaround (courtesy of Ashish K. Mathur)

What you have to do to get it to work is:
1. Where you have the RAC installed, open the configuration file config/serviceconfig.xml and make the following changes
    ---> a) One of the jars has not been updated. Locate the line that looks like the following
		<Variable name="CLASSPATH_ORG_ECLIPSE_CORE_RUNTIME" position="append" value="%PLUGINS_HOME%\org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.1.0.v20051027.jar"/>
	and change it to the following (notice the change in the version of the jar file in BOLD)
		<Variable name="CLASSPATH_ORG_ECLIPSE_CORE_RUNTIME" position="append" value="%PLUGINS_HOME%\org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.2.0.v20051208.jar"/>

    ---> b) A whole new jar is missing from the this file. Copy paste this line below into the config file, immediately following the line above.
		<Variable name="CLASSPATH_ORG_ECLIPSE_EQUINOX_COMMON" position="append" value="%PLUGINS_HOME%\org.eclipse.equinox.common_1.0.0.v20051205.jar"/>

    ---> c) Now we need to put the above variable in the class path of the rac. Locate the following line in the file
		<Variable name="CLASSPATH" position="append" value="%CLASSPATH_ORG_ECLIPSE_CORE_RUNTIME%"/>
	and add the following line immediately following it. 
		<Variable name="CLASSPATH" position="append" value="%CLASSPATH_ORG_ECLIPSE_EQUINOX_COMMON%"/>
    ---> d) Save and close the serviceconfig.xml

2. In your eclipse 3.2 M4 install, look for the plugin (its in the form of a jar) org.eclipse.equinox.common_1.0.0.v20051205.jar and copy it into <rac install dir>/plugins

3. Restart the RAC

4. Restart the workbench
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 123822 ***

Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.  

Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.
